title: Authors and Citation
text: Gustavo Frosi. Author, maintainer. Vidal Barrón. Author. Alberto Inda. Author. Kayn Bastiani. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Frosi G, Barrón V, Inda , Bastiani K (2025). OxSR: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance. R package version 1.0.1, https://fgu5tav0.github.io/OxSR/, https://github.com/FGu5tav0/OxSR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OxSR: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance},   author = {Gustavo Frosi and Vidal Barrón and Alberto Inda and Kayn Bastiani},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://fgu5tav0.github.io/OxSR/},   url = {https://github.com/FGu5tav0/OxSR/}, }

what: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
title: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
text: OxSR package calculates ratio hematite goethite oxides soil via diffuse reflectance. soil science, understanding mineral composition often starting point research various areas. Iron oxides widely studied play role range studies, fertilization nutrient dynamics contamination sustainable practices. Techniques determining minerals often expensive time-consuming. Therefore, practical, rapid, sensitive methods diffuse reflectance visible spectrum gained importance. technique can also used determine soil color, another parameter helps understanding environment.

title: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
code: # database data("soil_refle")  # one sample dados_relacao <- relation_hm_gt(data = soil_refle[,c(1,2)],                 plot = T,                name_wave = "wave",                points_smoothing = 0.3,                 pv_tolerance = c(1,1,1,1),                hm_gt_limits = list(hm = c(535, 585),                                    gt = c(430, 470))) # with several samples soil_refle |>  relation_hm_gt() |>    dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(2:7, ~ format(., scientific = TRUE, digits = 3))) |>   gt::gt()

title: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
code: dados_cor <- soil_refle |>  soil_color(plot = T) dados_cor |>    gt::gt()

title: Soil Iron Oxides via Diffuse Reflectance
code: # database Cary 5000 data_cary |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) |>    gt::gt() # database clean data_cary |>    clean_sheet_cary(prefix = "x") |>    dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) |>    gt::gt()

title: Organize Cary data — clean_sheet_cary
text: Cleans raw data extracted Cary 5000 UV-Vis-IR spectrophotometer, ensuring organized dataset analysis. process, duplicate columns containing wavelength removed avoid redundancy. Samples missing data also eliminated, ensuring complete measurements retained. Additionally, columns reordered based sample names, making easier interpret manipulate data. wavelength column placed first column, followed sample columns.

title: Organize Cary data — clean_sheet_cary
code: clean_sheet_cary(   data = data,   prefix = NULL,   name_wave = "Wave",   range_wave = c(380, 2500),   nm_step = 0.5 )

title: Organize Cary data — clean_sheet_cary
text: data data.frame containing wavelength reflectance values. obtained directly export CSV file. prefix Indicates prefix columns sample. usually predefined x .. name_wave Indicates name wavelength column. default 'wave'. range_wave wavelength range used. default 380 nm 2500 nm. nm_step increment nanometers consecutive wavelength readings. defines resolution measurements. default value 0.5 nm.

title: Organize Cary data — clean_sheet_cary
text: Returns organized data.frame

what: Diffuse soil reflectance via Cary equipment — data_cary
title: Diffuse soil reflectance via Cary equipment — data_cary
text: dataset containing diffuse reflectance measurements soil samples Brazil. data obtained using Cary 5000 UV-Vis-NIR spectrophotometer, covering spectral range 2500 nm 380 nm reading interval 0.5 nm (Frosi et al., 2025).

title: Diffuse soil reflectance via Cary equipment — data_cary
Diffuse soil reflectance via Cary equipment — data_cary
text: data frame 5,417 rows 52 columns: a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, a10, a11, a12, a13, a14, a15, a16, a17, a18, a19, a20, a21, a22, a23, a24, a26 Wavelength values nanometers sample (labeled ""). column represents wavelength specific sample. x2, x4, x6, x8, x10, x12, x14, x16, x18, x20, x22, x24, x26, x28, x30, x32, x34, x36, x38, x40, x42, x44, x46, x48, x50 Reflectance percentage (%R) corresponding wavelength sample. "x" columns represent reflectance values corresponding "" sample columns.

title: Diffuse soil reflectance via Cary equipment — data_cary
text: Frosi, G., Inda, ., & Barrón, V. (2025). Diffuse reflectance soils Brazil Data set. Zenodo. doi:10.5281/zenodo.14879041

title: Ratios Hm/(Hm+Gt) — relation_hm_gt
text: Calculates relationship iron oxides hematite goethite soil sample: $$Hm/Gt = \frac{\text{hematite}}{\text{hematite} + \text{goethite}}$$ based soil's diffuse reflectance curve visible spectrum, Kubelka-Munk equation, second derivative (Scheinost et al., 1998; Torrent et al., 2008).

title: Ratios Hm/(Hm+Gt) — relation_hm_gt
code: relation_hm_gt(   data = data,   points_smoothing = 0.3,   hm_gt_limits = list(hm = c(535, 585), gt = c(430, 460)),   pv_tolerance = c(0, 0, 0, 0),   name_wave = "wave",   plot = FALSE )

title: Ratios Hm/(Hm+Gt) — relation_hm_gt
text: data data.frame containing input data, first column wavelength remaining columns contain reflectance data sample. points_smoothing number points used smoothing data reduce noise spectral readings. default value 0.3. hm_gt_limits list containing detection range values hematite (hm) goethite (gt). default list(hm = c(535, 585), gt = c(430, 460)). pv_tolerance numeric vector 4 elements, corresponding one limits hematite (hm) goethite (gt). value specifies tolerance point values calculation, helping account small variations data controlling precision calculation. name_wave name wavelength column data. default, set 'wave'. plot logical value indicating whether generate plot results. set TRUE, plot displayed; FALSE, plot shown.

title: Ratios Hm/(Hm+Gt) — relation_hm_gt
text: data.frame sample rows columns containing minimum, maximum, amplitude Hm Gt, along Hm/Gt ratio.

title: Ratios Hm/(Hm+Gt) — relation_hm_gt
text: Scheinost, . C., Chavernas, ., Barrón, V., & Torrent, J. (1998). Use limitations second-derivative diffuse reflectance spectroscopy visible near-infrared range identify quantify Fe oxide minerals soil. Clays Clay Minerals, 46(5), 528–536. doi:10.1346/CCMN.1998.0460506 Torrent, J., & Barron, V. (2008). Diffuse Reflectance Spectroscopy. Methods Soil Analysis, 5, 367–385. doi:10.2136/sssabookser5.5.c13

what: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color
title: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color
text: function converts visible soil spectrum three-dimensional color systems, Munsell RGB, using CIE tristimulus values conversion. allows standardized representation colors facilitates visual comparative analysis.

title: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color
code: soil_color(data = data,            name_wave = "wave",            tri_values = "std",            plot = FALSE)

title: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color
text: data data.frame containing wavelength reflectance values. name_wave Character indicating name column wavelength. can initial characters. tri_values Tristimulus Values. Values colorSpec package can used. plot Logical, TRUE, plot colors generated, default FALSE

title: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color
text: data.frame color values Munsell, HVC, RGB, hexadecimal code.

title: Soil color by diffuse reflectance — soil_color

what: Diffuse reflectance of soils from Brazil — soil_refle
title: Diffuse reflectance of soils from Brazil — soil_refle
text: cleaned organized diffuse reflectance database. structure database includes first column wavelength used samples, remaining columns representing soil samples (Frosi et al., 2025).

title: Diffuse reflectance of soils from Brazil — soil_refle
Diffuse reflectance of soils from Brazil — soil_refle
text: data frame 4241 rows 24 columns: wavelength_nm Wavelength values nanometers. a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6, a7, a8, a9, a10, a11, a12, a13, a14, a15, a16, a17, a18, a19, a20, a22, a24, a26 Reflectance percentage (%R) corresponding soil sample.

title: Diffuse reflectance of soils from Brazil — soil_refle
text: Frosi, G., Inda, ., & Barrón, V. (2025). Diffuse reflectance soils Brazil Data set. Zenodo doi:10.5281/zenodo.14879041

title: OxSR 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-11 Initial CRAN submission.
